lines: It's time to sell raffle tickets for the school baseball team again.

Independence and self-sufficiency are desirable qualities. Your confidence is high. This will affect your Social sphere, which will, in turn, make you a better salesperson. Your first prospective sale is an elderly gentleman with
#SAY "EXCUSE ME, SIR, I'M SELLING RAFFLES FOR THE SCHOOL BASEBALL TEAM. WE ARE USING THE MONEY TO BUY NEW UNIFORMS AND SOME EQUIPMENT. WOULD YOU PLEASE BUY ONE?"
#SAY "EXCUSE ME. WOULD YOU LIKE TO BUY A RAFFLE FOR THE SCHOOL BASEBALL TEAM?"
The man has no patience for your long-winded chattering. He closes the door in your face.
The man can appreciate your direct pitch. He asks you the price of the tickets. You can:
#SAY "IT'S FOR A GOOD CAUSE, 25 CENTS EACH, 5 FOR 1 DOLLAR"
He replies, "I'll take ten." As he walks back into the house you hear him say, "I liked that young man. He had character."
He replies, "I wouldn't have asked how much they were if I didn't think it was for a good cause."
Going into such an endeavor with these feelings makes you easy to turn down. You spend three hours going door to door and sell four tickets for a total of one dollar.
The fourth ticket was purchased by your mother. SHE WINS! The grand prize is five hundred dollars, two hundred fifty of which she puts into a bank account with your name.

What a team! You move from door to door with confidence, selling four whole books in less than an hour. It's a powerful bonding experience that strengthens family ties. You go out for an ice-cream soda to celebrate your successful
Dad coaches you from the car as you go from door to door with little success. After an hour he asks if you would like to see how it's done. You can:
#TRY TO TALK HIM OUT OF IT

Dad shows you the "old foot-in-the-door technique" at Mrs. Marcus' house. This technique attracts the attention of both Mrs. Marcus and her 85-pound Doberman pinscher, Bruiser, who cleanly removes the front of Dad's sneaker. You can:
#SAY "THAT WAS PRETTY GOOD, BUT YOU CAN ONLY DO IT TWICE"
#SAY " MAYBE IT'S TIME TO WRAP IT UP FOR TODAY"
Now is not the best time to get wise, but he DID ask for it!
That was very sensitive. On the way home you stop and share a soda, which strengthens emotional ties and leaves you with a positive feeling.
"NONSENSE!" he says. "I'll show you how the PROS do it!"
